org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.slice

Class SliceHelper<S extends SliceVW>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.slice.SliceHelper<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - the type of the slices
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SliceKWHelper, SliceVWHelper

    public abstract class SliceHelper<S extends SliceVW>
extends java.lang.Object
    A SliceHelper is a helper class for the slice-based construction.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected FSA source_automaton
      The source NBW to be complemented.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SliceHelper(FSA a)
      Constructs this helper with a source NBW to be complemented.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void buildSourceSuccessorMap()
      Construct the source successor map that is heavily used in computing successors of a slice.
      protected boolean canMerge(SliceElement left, SliceElement right)
      Returns true if two adjacent decorated slice elements can be merged, that is, both are decorated by 0 or both are decorated by *.
      protected abstract S[] createInitialSlices()
      Creates the initial slices as the initial states of the complement.
      protected static java.util.List<java.util.List<SliceElement>> crossAppend(java.util.List<java.util.List<SliceElement>> elements1, java.util.List<java.util.List<SliceElement>> elements2)
      Given (E11, E12, ..., E1n) and (E21, E22, ..., E2m) where each Eij is a list of slice elements, return { ((E11 E21), (E12 E21), ..., (E1n E21)), ((E11 E22), (E12 E22), ..., (E1n E22)), ...
      protected Pair<StateSet,StateSet> getSliceElementSuccessor(SliceElement e, java.lang.String a)
      Returns the a-successors of a specified slice element as a pair accepting states and non-accepting states.
      protected abstract java.util.Set<S> getSliceSuccessors(S pred_slice, java.lang.String a)
      Get the a-successors of a slice.
      protected abstract boolean isAcceptingState(S slice)
      Returns true if the specified slice is an accepting state in the slice automaton.
      protected abstract boolean isCompleteTransitions()
      Returns true if the transition relation of the source NBW should be made complete.
      protected abstract boolean isUnnecessaryTransition(S pred, S succ)
      Returns true if the transition from a specified slice to another specified slice is unneeded.
      protected void mergeAdjacentSets(S slice)
      Merges two adjacent slice elements if both are decorated by * or both are decorated by 0.
      protected void reduceEmptySet(S slice)
      Removes all empty slice elements.
      protected void reduceRedundancy(SliceVW slice)
      Removes a state in a slice element e of a specified slice S if the state also appears in another slice element e' that is to the left of e in S.

        protected abstract S[] createInitialSlices()
        Creates the initial slices as the initial states of the complement.
        Returns:
        the initial slices

      • isUnnecessaryTransition

        protected abstract boolean isUnnecessaryTransition(S pred,
                                                   S succ)
        Returns true if the transition from a specified slice to another specified slice is unneeded. This methods is used when the optimization of reducing transitions is on.
        Parameters:
        pred - a predecessor
        succ - a successor of pred
        Returns:
        true if the transition from pred to succ is unneeded

      • isAcceptingState

        protected abstract boolean isAcceptingState(S slice)
        Returns true if the specified slice is an accepting state in the slice automaton.
        Parameters:
        slice - a slice
        Returns:
        true if slice is an accepting state in the slice automaton

      • getSliceSuccessors

        protected abstract java.util.Set<S> getSliceSuccessors(S pred_slice,
                                                       java.lang.String a)
        Get the a-successors of a slice. The returned successor slices are all properly decorated.
        Parameters:
        pred_slice - the predecessor
        a - the symbol
        Returns:
        a set of a-successors of slice

      • crossAppend

        protected static java.util.List<java.util.List<SliceElement>> crossAppend(java.util.List<java.util.List<SliceElement>> elements1,
                                                                          java.util.List<java.util.List<SliceElement>> elements2)
        Given (E11, E12, ..., E1n) and (E21, E22, ..., E2m) where each Eij is a list of slice elements, return { ((E11 E21), (E12 E21), ..., (E1n E21)), ((E11 E22), (E12 E22), ..., (E1n E22)), ... ((E11 E2m), (E12 E2m), ..., (E1n E2m)) }.
        Parameters:
        elements1 - a list of slices where each slice is represented as a list of slice elements
        elements2 - a list of slices where each slice is represented as a list of slice elements
        Returns:
        { ((E11 E21), (E12 E21), ..., (E1n E21)), ((E11 E22), (E12 E22), ..., (E1n E22)), ... ((E11 E2m), (E12 E2m), ..., (E1n E2m)) } where elements1 is (E11, E12, ..., E1n) and elements2 is (E21, E22, ..., E2m)

      • getSliceElementSuccessor

        protected Pair<StateSet,StateSet> getSliceElementSuccessor(SliceElement e,
                                                           java.lang.String a)
        Returns the a-successors of a specified slice element as a pair accepting states and non-accepting states.
        Parameters:
        e - a slice element
        a - a symbol in the alphabet of the source NBW
        Returns:
        the a-successors (acc, nonacc) of e with respect to the symbol a where acc is the set of accepting a-successors of e and nonacc is the set of non-accepting a-successor of e

      • reduceRedundancy

        protected void reduceRedundancy(SliceVW slice)
        Removes a state in a slice element e of a specified slice S if the state also appears in another slice element e' that is to the left of e in S.
        Parameters:
        slice - the slice to be reduced

      • reduceEmptySet

        protected void reduceEmptySet(S slice)
        Removes all empty slice elements.
        Parameters:
        slice - the slice to be reduced

      • canMerge

        protected boolean canMerge(SliceElement left,
                           SliceElement right)
        Returns true if two adjacent decorated slice elements can be merged, that is, both are decorated by 0 or both are decorated by *.
        Parameters:
        left - a decorated slice element that is at the left of right
        right - a decorated slice element that is at the right of left
        Returns:
        true if the two adjacent decorated slice elements left and right can be merged

      • mergeAdjacentSets

        protected void mergeAdjacentSets(S slice)
        Merges two adjacent slice elements if both are decorated by * or both are decorated by 0.
        Parameters:
        slice - the slice with slice elements to be merged
